wikipedia_page.main:
David Thaxton (born 12 May 1982) is a Welsh singer and musical theatre and opera performer. He starred in the Donmar Warehouse's Passion, for which he won the 2011 Olivier Award for Best Actor in a Musical. He previously starred as The Phantom in The Phantom Of The Opera, in Her Majesty’s Theatre. He previously appeared as Enjolras in the West End production of Les Misérables. In March 2011, he joined the cast of Love Never Dies, undertaking the role of Raoul de Chagny. Later then playing the role of Kevin T in the London production of Come From Away.
'
